title: Expert-LevelCryptoResearcher Needed for High-Impact YouTube Channel (Long-Term)
content:
ü™ô The Role

This is not a typicalcryptoresearch gig.

You won‚Äôt be summarizing blog posts or copying CoinMarketCap. You‚Äôll be building alpha-level, 10-page research documents that form the core of Coinvo‚Äôs YouTube content ‚Äî a new channel backed by a 315K+cryptoaudience on X.

You‚Äôll be expected to think like acryptoanalyst, communicate like a teacher, and uncover insights most people miss. Your research will be the reason someone watches the full video, saves it, and shares it with a friend.

üíº What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Responsibility	What It Means
- Produce 10-Page Research Docs: Notion or Google Docs, clearly structured with titles, examples, comparisons, visuals, and links
- Extract Expert Knowledge: Work with the CEO or trader to extract what they know through smart questions or async chats
- Find the Alpha: Research beyond the surface ‚Äî pull from SEC filings, whitepapers, protocol docs, earnings calls, niche Twitter threads
- Simplify Complex Ideas: Break down ETFs, tokenomics, or yield strategies for a general audience without watering them down
- Add Context + Visual Prompts: Suggest charts, graphs, and visuals that help the scriptwriter and editor bring it to life
- Deliver Loom Recaps (Optional Bonus): Show that you understand the research by recording a quick walkthrough explaining the core points

‚úÖ Who You Are

Deeplycrypto-native: You follow cycles, narratives, and on-chain trends
Comfortable researching topics like:
Covered call ETFs (e.g., YieldMax, Bitwise)
Bitcoin dominance and ETH/BTC flippening
Layer 2 scaling
Token unlocks and incentive mechanisms
You think in frameworks: You know how to make complexity feel simple by grouping ideas, using analogies, or building ‚Äúplaybooks‚Äù
Research-obsessed: You fact-check, cite sources, and double-verify charts and numbers
You write clearly, visually, and conversationally ‚Äî not like a textbook

üí∞ Payment & Trial

$75 per task
(Estimated 8‚Äì10 hours of work @ $7‚Äì$10/hour ‚Äî our CEO does this level himself)
You‚Äôll start with a paid trial: we‚Äôll assign a mini-topic to assess your clarity, thought process, and writing quality
Trial must be submitted within 48 hours
Even if we don‚Äôt hire you, we‚Äôll still pay you for submitting your work

üß† What Success Looks Like

You‚Äôre the team‚Äôs go-to researcher ‚Äî everyone builds on your work
Your research earns comments like:
‚ÄúI‚Äôve never seen it explained this well before.‚Äù
‚ÄúCoinvo is actually teaching me how to think.‚Äù
Your docs are:
Smartly structured
Backed with sources
Enhanced with visuals and examples
Easy for the scriptwriter to adapt into a banger video

‚öôÔ∏è Tools We Use

Notion
ChatGPT (with your brain in the driver‚Äôs seat)
Google Sheets + Token Terminal/Glassnode
Tella (for CEO breakdowns)
Slack, Loom, and ClickUp

üîó How to Apply

Apply directly here on Upwork
Tell us briefly about yourcryptobackground + Portfolio 
If shortlisted, we‚Äôll send you the trial task

title: CryptoAnalyst & Commentator
content:
We're a data-driven platform using proprietary social listening tools to track, rank, and analyzecryptoprojects based on community activity, sentiment, token metrics, and real-world adoption signals.

We're looking for a sharp, curious, and fundamentals-focusedCryptoAnalyst to surface promising projects, monitor the broadercryptoecosystem, and feed insights into our ranking and analytics engine. 

Role Overview:

You‚Äôll research and analyzecryptoprojects ‚Äî particularly early-stage or under-the-radar tokens ‚Äî with an eye for strong fundamentals (wallet activity, tokenomics, roadmap, developer and community traction). You'll also provide high-signal commentary on ecosystem trends, market shifts, and notable events (funding rounds, governance changes, chain activity surges, etc.).

This role is ideal for someone who:

- Understands what drives value in a token beyond price charts.
- Can cut through hype and spot real usage, adoption, and traction.
- Is plugged into communities, funding rounds, product launches, and protocol updates.

Key responsibilities:

- Identify early or undervaluedcryptoprojects with strong fundamental signals.
- Analyze wallet activity, tokenomics, emissions schedules, community health, and developer ecosystem.
- Tie findings to our social analytics tool, highlighting spikes or discrepancies in engagement vs. fundamentals.
- Deliver short, bullet-point research reports with links to sources (on-chain, GitHub, Discord, Twitter, project docs, etc.).
- Provide brief weekly commentary on broader market activity (e.g. protocol upgrades, L2 launches, regulatory impact).
- Optional: Add light technical context (charts, TVL shifts, momentum metrics) where relevant.

*Budget can be flexible dependent on level of insight and understanding.

title: Solana Trading Bot Upgrade ‚Äì PNL Fix, Market Cap UI, Speed Boost
content:
Title:
Solana Trading Bot Upgrade ‚Äì PNL Fix, Market Cap UI, Speed Boost

‚∏ª

Description:
I have a custom-built Solana-based trading bot and need a skilled developer to help with several upgrades and performance enhancements. The bot is already live and functional ‚Äî this task is about precision fixes, real-time performance tuning, and code refinement.

‚∏ª

Tasks:

1. Fix PNL % Calculation Bug
‚Ä¢ The bot currently calculates PNL using the token price at the moment the transaction is sent, which causes inaccurate results during volatile moments.
‚Ä¢ I need this corrected to use the confirmed transaction price: SOL spent √∑ tokens received.
‚Ä¢ Birdeye API is already integrated for fetching live token prices and can be used for cross-checking.

2. Add Market Cap to UI
‚Ä¢ Pull and display real-time market cap for tokens using Birdeye API.
‚Ä¢ Show this alongside existing token details in the UI (token name, price, amount held, etc.).

3. Optimize Bot Speed & Responsiveness
‚Ä¢ Improve execution speed and reduce lag between price fetch, transaction confirmation, and UI updates.
‚Ä¢ Prioritize low-latency execution during high activity (e.g., launch spikes).
‚Ä¢ Key focuses: priority fee handling, compute unit budgeting, RPC optimization, and performance tuning.

4. (Optional) Code Review & Refactor
‚Ä¢ Review current architecture and offer suggestions or improvements for long-term scalability and efficiency.

‚∏ª

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Strong experience with Solana transactions and token operations
‚Ä¢ Skilled with Birdeye API or similar on-chain analytics tools
‚Ä¢ Proficient in Python ‚Äî current bot codebase is Python-based
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to optimize RPC usage, compute budgets, and priority fee management
‚Ä¢ Performance tuning for real-time trading environments
‚Ä¢ Basic frontend/UI skills to update and display live data cleanly
‚Ä¢ Clean, modular coding with solid documentation
‚Ä¢ Must understand Ukrainian or Russian (for communication and/or reviewing parts of the existing codebase)

‚∏ª

Bonus Points For:
‚Ä¢ Experience using Jupiter API, Helius, or Solana webhooks
‚Ä¢ Built or contributed to Teleg trading bots, DEX bots, or memecoin automation tools
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of latency-reduction strategies for Solana tx pipelines

‚∏ª

privatekeyfromwallet:proxy
Each proxy is tied to a specific private key.

https://testnet.huddle01.com/welcome

Then, the bot should go to this link:
https://testnet.huddle01.com/quests,
click on "Meet-To-Earn", then click "Verify", and wait for around 30 seconds to receive HP (testnet points).

title: Smart Contract + Next.js ICO Pre-Sale DApp: Code Review, Devnet Testing & Mainnet Deployment
content:
We‚Äôve built a custom ICO pre-sale DApp using Next.js and a Solana smart contract written in Rust using Anchor. We‚Äôre looking for an experienced Solana developer to review the code, test the smart contract thoroughly on devnet, and deploy it to mainnet.

What You‚Äôll Do:
Review our full codebase (with emphasis on index.js, _app.js, and all pages)

Ensure all pages and UI components are functional and linked properly

Analyze and test the smart contract functionality:

30 pricing tiers

Price increases by 28% per tier (compounded)

5 million tokens per tier

Starts at $0.01

Total hard cap of 150 million tokens

Payment is in USDC

No claim button ‚Äî we‚Äôll manually distribute tokens based on on-chain logs

On-chain buyer registration: timestamp + token quantity

Test all logic on Solana devnet

Record the devnet testing process (screen recording or screencast)

Once confirmed, assist us with deploying on Solana mainnet (we provide the SOL for fees)

Technical Breakdown:
Smart Contract (Rust Anchor):

~210 lines of code

Accepts payments in USDC (not SOL)

Public constants:

TREASURY_ADDRESS (Phantom wallet to receive USDC)

USDC_MINT_ADDRESS (Official Solana USDC Mint)

SYTR_MINT_ADDRESS (Token to be distributed, already created)

Tracks total tokens sold

Updates price after every 5M tokens sold

Emits on-chain logs of buyers

Frontend (Next.js):

Responsive DApp frontend

Built with components for each page

_app.js handles global logic

index.js connects user wallet, displays sale status, and handles purchases

Requirements:
Expertise in Solana, Anchor, and token minting

Deep understanding of USDC payments on Solana

Experience testing and debugging smart contracts

Clear communication and availability for deployment help

title: 1inch fork with Uniswap UI
content:
Requirements:
Fork 1inch Codebase:
Fork the open-source 1inch protocol (e.g., 1inch-exchange) from GitHub, including the AggregationRouter and related smart contracts.

Remove reliance on 1inch‚Äôs off-chain Pathfinder API by implementing an on-chain routing algorithm:
Query liquidity pools directly (e.g., from integrated Sonic hubs).

Use on-chain oracles (e.g., Uniswap TWAP, Chainlink) for price data to ensure fully decentralized operation.

Optimize routing for gas efficiency on Sonic L1 (targeting 2‚Äì5x gas increase, ~10,000‚Äì25,000 gas per swap).

Trade Fee Structure:
Implement a 0.25% trade fee per swap:
0.2% allocated to a treasury wallet.

0.05% allocated to a prizes wallet for user rewards.

Automatically convert fees to USDC on-chain using Sonic-integrated liquidity pools (e.g., SwapX, Metropolis).

Ensure fee collection and conversion are gas-efficient and executed within the swap transaction.

Sonic Liquidity Hub Integration:
Integrate the following Sonic L1 liquidity hubs as the sole liquidity sources (no native liquidity pools):
Shadow: https://docs.shadow.so/pages/contract-addresses

SwapX: https://swapxfi.gitbook.io/swapx-docs/tokenomics/contracts

Metropolis: https://docs.metropolis.exchange/general-information/or-smart-contracts

Configure the on-chain routing algorithm to query these hubs for optimal swap paths.

Ensure compatibility with Sonic‚Äôs L1 architecture (EVM-compatible, low gas fees).

Uniswap-Style UI with Stats:
Develop a front-end interface modeled after Uniswap‚Äôs clean, user-friendly design (e.g., app.uniswap.org), emphasizing swap functionality and multi-DEX route visualization.

Display the following real-time statistics, sourced from on-chain data:
Total $ Volume: Aggregate trading volume across all swaps.

Total $ Rewards Distributed: Cumulative prizes paid out from the 0.05% fee pool.

$ Rewards Prize Pool + 24hr Countdown: Current prize pool balance and a 24-hour countdown for prize distribution cycles.

Ensure the UI interacts directly with on-chain contracts (no API dependencies), supports Sonic L1 wallet connections (e.g., MetaMask), and displays multi-DEX routes (e.g., Shadow ‚Üí SwapX).

Fully On-Chain Operation:
Eliminate all off-chain dependencies, including 1inch‚Äôs Pathfinder API or any gasless trade mechanisms.

Use on-chain data sources (e.g., Sonic hub pool reserves, oracles) for routing, pricing, and fee conversion.

Optimize smart contracts for Sonic‚Äôs low-gas L1 environment, targeting ~$0.01‚Äì$0.10 per swap (based on 2‚Äì5x gas increase).

Deployment on Sonic Testnet & Mainnet:
Deploy smart contracts and the Uniswap-based UI on the Sonic testnet and mainnet using AWS EC2 instances with SSH access for secure management.

Configure deployment scripts for reproducibility and scalability.

Ensure contracts are verified on Sonic‚Äôs block explorer (if available) for transparency.

Testing and Documentation:
Write comprehensive tests using Hardhat or Foundry to cover:
Swap functionality (routing, fee collection, USDC conversion).

Sonic hub integrations (Shadow, SwapX, Metropolis).

Treasury/prize wallet allocations.

Edge cases (e.g., low liquidity, high slippage, failed swaps).

Provide detailed documentation:
Codebase: Smart contract architecture, routing algorithm, and fee mechanisms.

UI: Front-end setup (Uniswap-based), on-chain data integration, and user flow.

Stats: How volume, rewards, and prize pool data are calculated and displayed.

Deliverables:
Customized 1inch Codebase:
Forked and modified 1inch protocol with:
0.25% trade fee (0.2% treasury, 0.05% prizes), auto-converted to USDC on-chain.

Sonic liquidity hub integrations (Shadow, SwapX, Metropolis,) with no native liquidity.

Fully on-chain routing and execution (no off-chain APIs).

Uniswap-Style UI:
Front-end interface with real-time stats:
Total $ Volume.

Total $ Rewards Distributed.

$ Rewards Prize Pool + 24hr Countdown.

Integrated with Sonic L1 and on-chain contracts, supporting multi-DEX route visualization.

Deployed DEX:
Fully tested smart contracts and UI deployed on Sonic testnet and mainnet via AWS EC2 with SSH access.

Verified contracts and reproducible deployment scripts.

Testing and Documentation:
Comprehensive test suite (Hardhat/Foundry) covering all features.

Detailed documentation for codebase, UI, and stats.

Application Instructions:
Add a link to your GitHub profile and relevant works to demonstrate experience with Solidity, React, DeFi protocols, and EVM-compatible blockchains.

Apply only if the budget matches or is close to your working rate.

title: CryptoNewsjacking Expert
content:
About Us

We're a leading PR and growth marketing agency in the Web3 space (www.theprgenius.com) , working with some of the most innovativecryptoand blockchain projects on the planet. Our mission is to position our clients at the forefront of industry narratives‚Äîand we‚Äôre looking for a sharp, fast-movingCryptoNewsjacking Expert to help us do exactly that.

Role Overview

As ourCryptoNewsjacking Expert, you‚Äôll be responsible for identifying breaking news opportunities and inserting our clients into the conversation in real-time‚Äîelevating their relevance, visibility, and authority in the space.
You‚Äôll be plugged into thecrypto, tech, and financial news cycle 24/7, and will collaborate closely with our media, strategy, and content teams to draft lightning-fast commentary, ideas, and hooks that catch the attention of journalists and industry leaders alike.

Key Responsibilities

Monitor real-time news cycles acrosscrypto, finance, tech, regulation, and macroeconomics for newsjacking opportunities.

Create rapid, relevant responses for client spokespeople to insert them into trending topics and breaking news.

Collaborate with content, comms, and media relations teams to pitch newsjacked stories to top-tier publications and journalists.

Ensure that all newsjacking content is respectful, credible, and aligned with each client‚Äôs brand voice and values.

Proactively plan for predictable news events (e.g., FOMC meetings, ETF approvals, protocol upgrades) with pre-prepared client reactions.

Track and report on engagement, pickup, and sentiment around newsjacked stories to optimize future execution.


Ideal Candidate
4+ years in PR, journalism, or comms, preferably withincrypto, tech, or finance.
A strong understanding ofcryptoculture, terminology, and market movements.
Proven ability to write fast, sharp, and relevant commentary under pressure.
Has strong media instincts‚Äîknows what journalists want and how to give it to them.
Comfortable working autonomously and at speed in a global, remote-first team.
Highly ethical‚Äîknows where the line is between opportunism and exploitation.

Bonus: Experience with social media trends and memetic content.


Why Join Us

Work with bleeding-edge Web3 projects shaping the future of finance and the internet.

Collaborate with a passionate, international team who love speed and creativity.

Flexible work hours and remote-first culture.

title: Blockchain Analyst for Token Audit (ERC-20 & Custom Chain)
content:
Title:
Blockchain Analyst Needed for Discreet Token Distribution & Wallet Activity Audit (ERC-20 & Custom Chain)

Description:
We are seeking a highly capable blockchain investigator to perform a discreet token analysis across Ethereum (ERC-20) and one custom blockchain. The objective is to verify wallet activity patterns, token distribution history, and liquidity behaviors across multiple addresses and platforms.

This is a precision-based, confidential assignment. You will receive a matrix of tasks and filenames upon onboarding, each of which involves one of the following:

Key Tasks:
- Confirm ERC-20 contract deployment dates and metadata
- Trace token distributions from an ERC-20 contract to downstream wallets
- Identify if certain wallets deposited tokens to CEXs or DEXs
- Cross-check wallet groups against known clusters (presale vs internal)
- Assess token release activity and distribution timelines
- Capture contract-level or app-based logic (if visible on-chain or frontend)
- Create charts or structured exports showing transfer timing, wallet maps, and flows

Requirements:
- Advanced proficiency with Etherscan, Debank, DEXTools, or similar tools
- Ability to extract and interpret raw transaction data
- Familiarity with wallet clustering and tokenomics audits
- (Bonus) Experience with bridging, vesting contracts, or release mechanisms
- Professional communication and strict adherence to confidentiality

Deliverables:
- CSVs of wallet transfers
- Screenshots of key findings (timestamped)
- Optional: Token flow visual map
- Short, structured notes explaining each method
- Organized according to provided matrix & filenames

Budget:
Initial scope estimated at $800 AUD
Additional bonuses available for quality visuals or forensic presentation formatting

Important Notes:
- You will be required to sign a brief NDA before full details, addresses, or project context are shared.
- This is a research-first engagement. No code development or smart contract writing required.
- You will be evaluated on clarity, reproducibility, and attention to detail.

To apply, please:
- Briefly describe 1‚Äì2 similar investigations you‚Äôve completed
- List the tools you use most for ERC-20 and wallet flow analysis
- Provide an example output if possible (blur/redact as needed)

content:
It is needed to developcryptotrading bot that trade on Binance futures using my own strategy. All is written in spec file.
The program is built on a moving-average crossover strategy. Two types of moving averages are used ‚Äì SMA and EMA, with different periods. Futures trading is conducted on the Binance exchange. title: Web 3 development
content:
Job Title:
Web3 Developer Needed to Launch NFT Contributor System for DeFi Protocol (ERC-1155 on Polygon)

Job Description:
We are building DeLen.io, a next-generation DeFi platform focused on Bitcoin-backed lending and community-driven governance. In Phase 1, we aim to launch a contributor NFT system that will onboard early supporters through tiered NFTs with defined rights and benefits.

We are looking for a skilled Web3 developer or development team to help us deploy the ERC-1155 smart contract, configure NFT metadata and claim conditions, and build a public-facing minting interface for users.

Scope of Work ‚Äì Phase 1: Contributor NFTs

Objective:
Deploy a multi-tier NFT system on Polygon Mainnet that allows contributors to mint NFTs representing their level of participation in the DeLen protocol (Genesis Key, Protocol Key, DeTribe Pass).

Tasks:

NFT Contract Deployment
Deploy ERC-1155 Edition Drop contract using thirdweb (or custom contract if required)
Define Token IDs and supply caps for three tiers
Set royalty structure and payout address
Ensure visibility on OpenSea
NFT Metadata and IPFS Integration
Design and upload images for all three NFT tiers
Create metadata files in JSON format
Host metadata and images on IPFS
Claim Logic and Mint Configuration
Set public mint prices in MATIC or USDC
Define supply limits and wallet restrictions
Configure claim conditions for each token ID using thirdweb dashboard
Frontend Minting Page
Option A: Set up thirdweb‚Äôs no-code minting page
Option B (preferred): Develop a custom minting UI using thirdweb SDK in React or Next.js
Include wallet connection and token selection features
Testing and Validation
Test minting functionality on Polygon
Ensure NFTs display correctly on OpenSea with full metadata
Provide documentation for admin actions such as editing claim conditions or uploading new NFTs
Deliverables:

Deployed and verified ERC-1155 smart contract on Polygon
Metadata files and images hosted on IPFS
Minting interface (hosted or embeddable)
At least one minted NFT from each tier (Genesis, Protocol, DeTribe)
Admin instruction guide for managing NFTs and claims
Ideal Candidate:

Experience deploying ERC-1155 NFT contracts on Polygon
Familiarity with thirdweb, IPFS, and NFT metadata standards
Experience building Web3 frontends using React or Next.js
Ability to complete the scope within 2 to 3 weeks
About the Project:
DeLen.io is hosted by Revacon Technologies Pvt. Ltd., focused on building decentralized financial tools that connect Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term value to everyday fiat use cases.

Timeline:
Project to be completed within 2‚Äì3 weeks of engagement.

Budget:
Please submit your proposal with estimated cost, timeline, and examples of previous work related to NFTs or DeFi projects.

title: Full Stack Developer for B2B Trading Platform (web app MVP)
content:
We‚Äôre building a role-based B2B trading web app to facilitate secure gold transactions between verified mines, exporters, importers, and offtakers. Each user type has access to unique workflows. All payments will be held in escrow until delivery is confirmed, with the long-term goal of recording transactions on-chain for transparency.

We‚Äôve completed a detailed Figma prototype (~400 screens) and are now hiring a full stack developer to build the MVP as a responsive web application. This is not a native mobile app.

Scope of Work:
- Set up backend infrastructure (Node.js/NestJS or preferred modern stack)
- Implement secure authentication, onboarding, and KYC flows for each user type
- Build core flows: listing items, making offers, accepting/rejecting, and managing orders
- Implement admin panel for account approvals, dispute management, and payout control
- Stub escrow logic (funds held until buyer/seller approve)
- Prepare all routes and components for future integration with smart contracts and a payment provider
- Connect backend logic to the UI (you will work with Figma; UI integrator will join later)

You Should Have:
- 3+ years of full stack development experience
- Strong understanding of role-based access control and platform security
- Experience building admin panels, dashboards, or marketplaces
- Familiarity withcryptoflows or escrow logic is a plus
- Ability to work independently from a detailed Figma prototype
- Clean architecture and Git workflow habits

Deliverables:
- MVP web app backend (user roles, listing, offers, escrow logic)
- Admin dashboard with user/document review tools
- API-ready structure for future front-end and blockchain integrations
- Clean, well-documented codebase

title: CryptoNow.com ‚Äî Real-TimeCryptoMarket Dashboard (Autopilot MVP)
content:
Project Overview
We‚Äôre launchingCryptoNow.com as a clean, mobile-friendly homepage that gives users a real-time view of what‚Äôs happening in thecryptomarkets. This MVP combines:
	‚Ä¢	Top coin prices
	‚Ä¢	Biggest daily gainers/losers
	‚Ä¢	Trendingcryptonews headlines
The goal is to create a ‚Äúcryptopulse‚Äù landing page ‚Äî fast, self-refreshing, and visually engaging ‚Äî that runs fully on autopilot with no login, no content writing, and no database-intensive backend.

‚∏ª

Core Features
Top Coin Price Strip
	‚Ä¢	Pull top 10‚Äì20 coins via CoinGecko API
	‚Ä¢	Display:
		‚Ä¢	Name + symbol
		‚Ä¢	Current price
		‚Ä¢	24h % change (color coded: green/red)
		‚Ä¢	Optional: live refresh every 10‚Äì15 min (cron or AJAX)
Biggest Movers Section
	‚Ä¢	Pull top 5 gainers and 5 losers based on 24h %
	‚Ä¢	Highlight with arrows, color indicators, or mini sparkline (optional)
	‚Ä¢	Sort automatically using API dataCryptoNews Feed
	‚Ä¢	Parse and display recent headlines via public RSS feeds:
	‚Ä¢	Cointelegraph
	‚Ä¢	CoinDesk
	‚Ä¢	Decrypt
	‚Ä¢	Each headline links out to source
	‚Ä¢	Include time of post and category tag (if available)

‚∏ª

Homepage Layout
	‚Ä¢	Top: ‚ÄúToday‚Äôs Market Pulse‚Äù bar (coins + change)
	‚Ä¢	Left or center: news feed
	‚Ä¢	Right or bottom: biggest movers
	‚Ä¢	Mobile: stacked layout, scroll-friendly
	‚Ä¢	Branding: simpleCryptoNow.com header, modern but light style

‚∏ª

Development Environment (Required)
	This project must be:
		‚Ä¢	 Developed inside your assigned container
		‚Ä¢ 	SSH with root/sudo access will be provided
		‚Ä¢	 Local development is permitted for prototyping, but all validation and final delivery must be tested from the container

‚∏ª

Technical Stack
	‚Ä¢	PHP 7.x or 8.x
	‚Ä¢	Bootstrap 5 or similar responsive CSS
	‚Ä¢	CoinGecko API (public/free tier acceptable)
	‚Ä¢	RSS parsing (PHP-based or native feed reader)
	‚Ä¢	Apache + .htaccess for clean URLs
	‚Ä¢	No login system, no user tracking
	‚Ä¢	No JavaScript frameworks (React, Vue, etc.)

‚∏ª

Deliverables
	‚Ä¢	Complete source code (PHP, HTML, CSS)
	‚Ä¢	API integration with working outputs
	‚Ä¢	Static homepage served from container root
	‚Ä¢	.htaccess for routing if multiple pages
	‚Ä¢	README including:
	‚Ä¢	Container setup instructions
	‚Ä¢	API endpoints used
	‚Ä¢	How to adjust refresh rates or feed sources

‚∏ª

Fixed Budget and Timeline
	‚Ä¢	Fixed Price: $850
	‚Ä¢	Timeline: 10‚Äì14 calendar days
	‚Ä¢	Week 1: Price + news integration
	‚Ä¢	Week 2: Layout polish + delivery

title: Non-Custodial Stablecoin Wallet (USDC/USDT) Research & Fine Tune Product Concept
content:
I'm looking for someone with technical expertise in non-custodial wallets , fiat on/off-ramps , payments infrastructure , and privacy-first design to help refine the product features, validate its feasibility, and architect the optimal tech stack.

We're building a non-custodial stablecoin wallet that delivers a simple, intuitive, and private user experience. Users hold their own funds at all times ‚Äî we don‚Äôt hold their deposits/top-ups or even personal data to certain extent. Instead, we integrate licensed third-party services (KYC, fiat rails, card issuance via EMIs) directly within the app, enabling seamless buying, sending, and spending ‚Äî without requiring users to leave the interface or experience any of thecrypto/web3 terminology.

If you have deep technical experience in blockchain , fintech , or privacy engineering , and are comfortable validating, refining, and structuring existing ideas with a focus on execution ‚Äî please PM me for more details

title: Penetration Tester forCryptoPoker Platform - Base + Bonus Per Vulnerability
content:
Penetration Tester Needed forCryptoPoker Platform | Base + Bonus Per Vulnerability

---

*Description:*
We are seeking an experienced *penetration tester* or *ethical hacker* to audit and stress-test our web-based *cryptopoker platform. This role is performance-incentivized ‚Äî you‚Äôll receive a **base fee* plus *bonuses for each verified vulnerability* you discover, based on severity.

---

*About the Platform:*

* Web-based, no install required
*Crypto-native (cryptowallets, real-time USDC/ETH transactions)
* websocket game engine, and proprietary player logic
* Security and fairness are key pillars of our platform

---

*What We Need:*
You‚Äôll simulate both internal and external attacks to identify real-world security threats across:

* Web application (frontend & backend)
* Authentication & authorization
* Smart contracts (if applicable)
* WebSocket-based gameplay
*Cryptotransaction logic
* Rate limiting, CAPTCHA, abuse vectors
*Client-side manipulation: illegal actions (e.g., bypassing turn order, injecting fake moves)

*Game integrity: forced disconnects, desyncs, manipulating game state or pot logic

System stability: crashing or freezing the server, infinite loops, flooding WebSocket/API


---

**Payment Structure:*

*  *Base pay:* Negotiable based on experience
*  *Bonus per confirmed vulnerability:*

:

 Critical (Level 3) ‚Äî $300
Examples:

Remote Code Execution (RCE)

SQL injection leading to full database access

Private key or wallet exposure

Ability to manipulate balances or unauthorized fund transfers

Bypass of authentication or impersonation of other users

 High (Level 2) ‚Äî $100
Examples:

Access to another user‚Äôs account or hand history

Broken authorization allowing actions like unauthorized chip transfer

Persistent XSS in critical areas (e.g., lobby chat, usernames)

Manipulating game logic or smart contract to gain unfair advantage

Bypass of rate limiting or betting rules

 Medium (Level 1) ‚Äî $50
Examples:

Reflected XSS

Missing security headers (e.g., CSP, HSTS)

Directory listing or verbose server errors

Information leakage (e.g., tech stack details, internal endpoints)

Insecure cookie flags or session handling



Each vulnerability must include:

* Reproducible PoC
* Risk analysis
* Suggested mitigation

---

*Requirements:*

* Proven experience in web app pentesting
* Strong knowledge of OWASP Top 10
* Familiar withcryptosecurity principles (wallets, smart contracts, signature flows)
* Able to work discreetly and professionally under NDA

---

*Nice to Have:*

* Experience testing WebSocket or real-time multiplayer games
* Background in poker or online gaming security
* Familiarity with DDoS and anti-bot defense strategies

---

*To Apply:*
Send us:

1. Brief intro and your experience
2. Tools you use
3. Notable past vulnerabilities you‚Äôve discovered (no need to share private client info)
4. Your base fee expectation

---

*This is a private bounty-style opportunity with potential for recurring work.*
Help us build the most secure poker platform on the blockchain.

title: Development of Manual Payment Gateway with Wallet Agent Management System
content:
üìå Key Fuctional Requirements
‚úÖ1. Wallet Management System (Seperate Website)
Build a dedicated management panel (admin + agents interface).
No integration needed directly with the main website backend; it just receives requests.
The system will have the following key sections:

Deposit Requests
Withdrawal Requests
Pending Deposits
Pending Withdrawals

‚úÖ2. Agents and Admin Roles
Admin can manage all transactions and view agent activity.

Agents:
Deposit USDT into the system (you'll build thecryptowallet system here).
Handle requests sent from the main website (deposit to a user‚Äôs account or confirm withdrawal).

‚úÖ3. Deposit Process
Users on the main website initiate deposit requests.
These requests are displayed on the management panel.
Agents confirm them after checking the USDT deposit.

‚úÖ4. Withdrawal Process
Users request withdrawal from the main site (in local currency).
Agent manually transfers funds from their own wallet to the requested account.
After sending, they click "Confirm" in the panel.

‚úÖ5. Currency Conversion
Currency rate will be set manually by the admin.
Agents deposit in USDT, but main website users operate in local currency.

title: Full-Stack Architect: Polygon DeFi Platform - Uniswap V4, Golang, Asset-Backed Token
content:
We are seeking an elite development team or individual to architect and construct the "Financial Platform," a sophisticated decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem built on the Polygon Layer 2 network. This project aims to leverage Polygon 2.0's vision for a "Value Layer of the Internet," delivering high-speed, low-cost transactions for token creation, trading, and payments.

Key technical deliverables include:
- Smart Contract Engineering: Development of a secure ERC-20 token using Solidity and OpenZeppelin libraries, including robust minting mechanisms and role-based access control.
- DEX Integration: Seamless integration with Uniswap V4 on Polygon, capitalizing on its customizability, potential for lower transaction fees, and utilization of "hooks" for bespoke logic (e.g., dynamic fees, automated pool management).
- High-Performance Backend: Design and implementation of backend services using Golang, focusing on concurrency and performance for API endpoints, Polygon transaction monitoring, off-chain price feed aggregation (Chainlink/Pyth/1inch), and Layer 2 user management.
- Dynamic Frontend: Development of a responsive frontend using React or Next.js, interacting with smart contracts via Web3.js/Ethers.js and MetaMask wallet integration (window.ethereum).
- Fiat On-Ramp: Integration of fiat currency payment processing (e.g., Stripe) for stablecoin purchases on Polygon, coupled with oracle services for accurate USD-Anukn valuation.
- Asset-Backed Tokenomics: Implementation of a unique asset-backed model where Anukn tokens are backed by a reserve of physical assets, requiring secure custody considerations and transparent valuation mechanisms.

This project demands expertise in blockchain architecture, advanced smart contract development, DeFi protocols, full-stack web development (Golang/React/Next.js), and secure third-party service integrations.

title: SEO & Copywriting Expert
content:
AboutCryptoConsulting InstituteCryptoConsulting Institute (CCI) is a market-leading provider ofcryptocurrencyeducation, consulting services, and digital resources for individuals and businesses navigating the rapidly evolvingcryptoeconomy. We deliver high-impact advisory services, market insights, and educational content designed to empower our clients and elevate the globalcryptocommunity.

Position Overview
We are seeking a results-driven SEO & Copywriting Expert to join our growing marketing team. This role is responsible for developing and executing CCI‚Äôs SEO strategy while producing high-quality, engaging, and conversion-focused content across multiple digital platforms.
The ideal candidate is a sharp writer with a deep understanding ofcryptomarkets, SEO optimization techniques, and digital content marketing strategies aimed at driving organic traffic, increasing brand authority, and generating qualified leads.

Key Responsibilities

SEO Strategy & Execution

- Develop, implement, and continuously optimize SEO strategies for CCI‚Äôs website, landing pages, blog, and digital assets.
- Conduct keyword research, competitor analysis, and content gap audits to identify ranking opportunities.
- Manage on-page and off-page SEO activities, including meta-data optimization, internal linking structures, and backlink acquisition.

Content Planning & Development

- Plan and produce long-form articles, blog posts, website copy, product descriptions, email campaigns, and educational resources tailored forcryptoinvestors and enterprise clients.
- Write with clarity, authority, and conversion focus while maintaining brand voice and positioning.


Technical SEO & Analytics

- Collaborate with web developers and UI/UX teams to optimize site speed, crawlability, indexability, and mobile responsiveness.
- Monitor SEO performance through tools like Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMrush, or Ahrefs and provide regular reports and actionable insights.


Content Marketing & Campaign Support

- Assist in developing SEO-driven content marketing campaigns, social media content strategies, and email marketing initiatives.
- Optimize existing content for SEO and user engagement, updating older pages and blog posts where necessary.


Industry Research & Trend Analysis

- Stay up-to-date with the latest SEO trends,cryptoindustry news, Google algorithm updates, and best practices to keep CCI ahead of the curve.
- Identify new content opportunities and search trends relevant to thecryptoand fintech sectors.



Key Skills & Qualifications

Essential:

- 3+ years of proven SEO and digital copywriting experience, preferably incrypto, fintech, or SaaS environments.
- Strong knowledge of SEO tools such as SEMrush, Ahrefs, Google Analytics, and Google Search Console.
- Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills with a portfolio of published content.
- Demonstrated ability to write clear, concise, and engaging content tailored for web users and aligned with SEO best practices.
- Understanding of keyword research, content clustering, link-building strategies, and SERP optimization.
- Familiarity with CMS platforms (e.g., WordPress) and basic HTML.
- Excellent organizational, time management, and communication skills.


Desirable:

- Experience working within a fast-paced startup orcryptoenvironment.
- Knowledge of Web3, DeFi, NFTs, and blockchain technology.
- Experience with AI content tools (e.g., Jasper, SurferSEO, Frase).


Performance Metrics & KPIs

- Growth in organic website traffic and keyword rankings.
- Increase in lead generation and content engagement metrics (CTR, bounce rate, session duration).
- Successful delivery of SEO-optimized content within agreed deadlines.
- Improvement in domain authority and backlink profile.
- Positive feedback from internal teams and clients on content quality and messaging alignment.



Why Join CCI?

-Work on exciting, high-impact projects in one of the world‚Äôs most dynamic industries.
- Be part of a collaborative, agile, and entrepreneurial team driving real change in thecryptospace.
- Flexible remote work options and competitive compensation packages.
- Access tocryptomarket insights, training, and networking opportunities within a growing global community.

title: üöÄ Build a Smart AI-PoweredCryptoTrading & Alert Bot
content:
üß† Project Summary
I‚Äôm looking for a developer to build the MVP for roninbot.ai ‚Äî a smart, AI-enhancedcryptotrading assistant. The system will track a selected list of coins, monitor technical and sentiment signals, and deliver actionable alerts through a command interface. It should integrate with technical analysis tools, real-time data sources, and language model APIs to generate insightful summaries.

This is not a full trading automation tool ‚Äî it‚Äôs designed to support better manual trading decisions using intelligent signal aggregation.

üîß MVP Scope
1. Command-Based Alert System
Should allow users to input commands to get:
- Market summaries
- Real-time price checks
- Token-specific trend overviews
- A list of coins being watched

2. Webhook-Based Trigger Integration
- The bot should listen for alerts from external charting or market monitoring tools
- Parse incoming alerts and match pre-defined trigger levels (e.g. Fibonacci or key psychological levels)
- Send readable, well-formatted alerts through the interface

3. AI-Powered Summary Generator
Use a language model API to generate:
- Daily market overview
- Token-specific trend analysis
- Summaries must be formatted clearly for mobile or chat-style reading

4. Sentiment and Event Monitoring
- Monitor publicly available forums and social feeds (e.g.,cryptodiscussion boards and event aggregators)
- Detect spikes in attention or sentiment around tracked coins

5. Watchlist and Lightweight Data Storage
- Track around 10 coins
- Store key levels and trigger history
- Use a minimal JSON or SQLite storage layer

‚úÖ Examples & Sample Inputs
Example Alert Output
Price Alert: ETHUSDT
Trigger: 0.618 Fibonacci Level
Price: 3,260
Comment: Confluence area reached ‚Äî monitor for breakout or rejection
Time: 16 May, 09:25 UTC

Example Alert Payload
"ticker": "ETHUSDT"
"price": 3260.25
"fib_level": "0.618"
"alert_type": "Retracement Trigger"
"time": "2025-05-16T09:25:00Z"
"note": "Price hit resistance zone"

Sample Watchlist
Token	Type	Key Levels	Notes
ETH	Layer 1	0.382, 0.5, 0.618	High conviction
SOL	Layer 1	0.5, 0.618	Watch for major breakouts
FET	AI	0.382, 0.618	Sentiment-sensitive
BOME	Meme	0.5, 0.786	Driven by social attention
INJ	Oracle	0.382, 0.618, 0.786	Follow on-chain activity

Sample Prompt for AI Summary
Prompt:
‚ÄúSummarize the market sentiment for Fetch.AI (FET) based on public posts andcryptonews headlines. Indicate whether the trend is bullish or bearish and explain why.‚Äù

Example Output:
"FET is showing mild bullish momentum. Public chatter highlights partnerships in AI and rising trading volume. However, some caution is noted around short-term volatility."

üíª Tech Requirements
- Strong Python skills preferred (Node.js or Go also acceptable)
- Experience with API integrations: market data, alert systems, and language models
- Familiarity with automation and parsing JSON/webhook payloads
- Experience designing modular, documented tools

üóÇÔ∏è Deliverables
- A functioning MVP of the alert system
- Fully integrated command interface with trigger and AI functionality
- Clear setup instructions and environment configuration
- Optional: lightweight deployment setup or Docker container

üí∏ Budget and Timeline
Fixed Price: 4,500 AUD

Timeline: approximately 3 weeks
Milestone-based delivery is preferred

üí¨ To Apply, Please Include:
- Relevant examples of bots, trading tools, or AI assistants you‚Äôve built
- A short outline of how you‚Äôd approach this build
- Your preferred tech stack
- Your timeline estimate and milestone suggestions 
- Any ideas you have to improve the MVP

title: Project Title: Development of an AI Agent for Forex andCryptocurrencyTrading

	1.	Scope of Work:

title: Drafting legal documents forcryptotoken project
content:
Our company is an emerging European startup in VR (virtual reality) industry. Our project is a virtual reality based global community, whose membership rights are represented by our own token (basically an NFT). According to our White Paper, whoever holds the NFT (is a member of the community) receives regular bonuses (as utility) from our company's investments, as it keeps growing. Beside investing into our own VR project, our company also has investments incrypto(we have our owncryptotrading bot) and real estate. The bonuses regularly paid to members are financed from our companies profits from it's own investments. 

Our token represents membership of a VR based community, and does not mean any type of investment regulated by any specific authority. We don't collect deposits, we don't handle client money, we don't offer corporate rights.

The candidate we are looking for drafts regulations and terms and conditions that we publish on our website, that serve legal purposes.

The candidate shall research similar projects, take their online available regulations, and adjust it as much as needed to our industry, for a symbolic 500 USD freelancer fee, as we regard this as an entry project into cooperating with us.

title: Smart Contract + Next.js ICO Pre-Sale DApp: Code Review, Devnet Testing & Mainnet Deployment
content:
We‚Äôve built a custom ICO pre-sale DApp using Next.js and a Solana smart contract written in Rust using Anchor. We‚Äôre looking for an experienced Solana developer to review the code, test the smart contract thoroughly on devnet, and deploy it to mainnet.

What You‚Äôll Do:
Review our full codebase (with emphasis on index.js, _app.js, and all pages)

Ensure all pages and UI components are functional and linked properly

Analyze and test the smart contract functionality:

30 pricing tiers

Price increases by 28% per tier (compounded)

5 million tokens per tier

Starts at $0.01

Total hard cap of 150 million tokens

Payment is in USDC

No claim button ‚Äî we‚Äôll manually distribute tokens based on on-chain logs

On-chain buyer registration: timestamp + token quantity

Test all logic on Solana devnet

Record the devnet testing process (screen recording or screencast)

Once confirmed, assist us with deploying on Solana mainnet (we provide the SOL for fees)

Technical Breakdown:
Smart Contract (Rust Anchor):

~210 lines of code

Accepts payments in USDC (not SOL)

Public constants:

TREASURY_ADDRESS (Phantom wallet to receive USDC)

USDC_MINT_ADDRESS (Official Solana USDC Mint)

SYTR_MINT_ADDRESS (Token to be distributed, already created)

Tracks total tokens sold

Updates price after every 5M tokens sold

Emits on-chain logs of buyers

Frontend (Next.js):

Responsive DApp frontend

Built with components for each page

_app.js handles global logic

index.js connects user wallet, displays sale status, and handles purchases

Requirements:
Expertise in Solana, Anchor, and token minting

Deep understanding of USDC payments on Solana

Experience testing and debugging smart contracts

Clear communication and availability for deployment help

Budget:
$300‚Äì$450 (fixed)

Timeline:
We need this urgently ‚Äî ideally within 24‚Äì48 hours of starting. We‚Äôre happy to send the complete project folder immediately after contract is accepted.

title: Blockchain Engineer(Bitcoin Core, Node, Layer 2, Smart Contract, Team Leadership, Client Engagement)
content:
We're looking for an experienced Blockchain Engineer to join our team. This role involves contributing to Bitcoin Core (Node), building Layer 2 solutions, developing smart contracts, and managing both internal teams and client relationships. You'll need a strong technical background in blockchain technologies and solid communication and leadership skills.

Responsibilities:
1. Bitcoin Core Development
Improve and maintain Bitcoin Core.
Fix bugs, enhance performance, and collaborate with the open-source community.
2. Layer 2 Solutions
Build and integrate Layer 2 technologies (e.g., Lightning Network, Rollups).
Optimize for scalability and transaction efficiency.
3. Smart Contracts
Develop and audit smart contracts (ERC-20, ERC-721, ERC-1155).
Support dApp and DeFi project implementation.
4. Protocol & Full-Stack Development
Write high-performance code in C, C++, Rust, and TypeScript.
Contribute to both backend and frontend blockchain systems.
5. Blockchain Storage
Use and optimize storage solutions like LevelDB, RocksDB, and PostgreSQL.
Ensure fast data retrieval and scalability.
6. Client Communication
Interface with clients to understand needs and propose blockchain solutions.
Bridge the gap between technical teams and stakeholders.
7. Team Management
Lead and mentor blockchain developers.
Allocate tasks, track progress, and maintain delivery timelines.
8. Research & Innovation
Stay updated with blockchain trends and technologies.
Share insights and experiment with new ideas to improve systems.
9. Cross-Functional Collaboration
Work closely with designers, analysts, and PMs.
Report project updates and work through challenges with the team.

Soft Skills:
Excellent client communication and problem-solving.
Strong leadership and project management.
Ability to explain complex blockchain concepts clearly.

Experience:
8+ years in blockchain development.
Contributions to open-source projects.
Familiar with agile workflows.

Preferred:
Bitcoin Core or open-source contributions.
Startup or distributed team experience.
Knowledge of other chains (Ethereum, Solana, Polkadot).
Advanced degree in CS

Why Join Us:
Work on cutting-edge blockchain and DeFi projects.
Join a collaborative and talented team.
Enjoy competitive pay, flexible work, and professional growth.

title: Build Real-Time Bid-Ask Ratio Signal Tool with Alerts Using Binance & Coinbase Spot APIs
content:
Description:
I‚Äôm looking to recreate a real-time Bid-Ask Ratio signal tool I previously relied on inside TradingLite. That platform is now offline, but the indicator was central to my trading edge.

The tool must:

Stream live order book data from Binance Spot and Coinbase Spot

Calculate a rolling Bid/Ask Volume Ratio

Fire clear, unmissable signals when ratio exceeds a set threshold (for example, 2.0 = strong buy)

Deliver visual and audio alerts

Be hosted in a web-accessible dashboard I can check from desktop or mobile

Key Functionality:
Real-Time Order Book Streaming

WebSocket integration with Binance and Coinbase Spot

Track configurable top price levels (such as top 10‚Äì25)

Refresh interval: ideally 1 second or better

Bid-Ask Ratio Signal Logic

Compute: total bid volume divided by total ask volume at each refresh

Custom threshold (default: 2.0)

Signal logic:

If ratio exceeds threshold, fire signal

Optional reset or cool-down period

Show ratio in real time with a color shift when over threshold

Alerts and Notifications

Visual cue such as color flash or highlighted ratio

Audio alert when signal fires (must be noticeable)

Optional: webhook or email push alerts in future versions

Simple, Accessible UI

Minimalist dashboard built with Streamlit, Dash, or React

Should display:

Current trading pair

Live ratio and optional mini chart of past values

Timestamp of last signal

Must be mobile and tablet accessible

Basic User Configs

Choose exchange (Binance or Coinbase)

Select trading pair (for example, BTC/USDT)

Adjust ratio threshold

Enable or disable alerts

Ideal Candidate Will Have:
Experience working with real-timecryptoWebSocket APIs

Strong skills in Python (preferred) or Node.js

Familiarity with orderbook depth and trading tools

Ability to build clean, responsive dashboards

Bonus: experience with signal generation or alert systems

What to Include in Your Proposal:
Relevant experience and examples of similar tools

Preferred tech stack

Estimated timeline and cost for MVP

Suggestions for improving performance or usability

Why This Matters:
This is the first tool in a broader suite of real-time trading indicators. Strong execution here could lead to ongoing collaboration and future builds.

Let‚Äôs create something fast, intuitive, and highly effective.

Are you a natural leader with experience in NFTs,crypto, crowdfunding marketing, social media, or sales? We‚Äôre building a global team of passionate professionals to lead VMTcoin and VM NFTs into the future!

As a Team Leader Ambassador, you'll:

1. Build and lead a local or international sales team

2. Drive marketing and lead generation for our crowdfunding campaigns

3. Promote our innovative ecosystem of NFTs, VMTcoin, artisan products, wines and social impact

Perks include exclusive NFTs, royalties from physical products sales, gifts, physical products,cryptotokens, NFTs, exclusive memberships and owner certificates and performance bonuses.

Apply now and become part of a mission that blends blockchain, luxury, and social change!

More details & rewards: https://www.vmtcoin.com/pages/perks-for-team-leaders‚Äì Visit the ‚ÄúFounder's Badge "Team Leader Ambassador"  page.

title: Looking for Project Manager to Collaborate on Payment Platform Evolution
content:
We‚Äôre looking to connect with experienced Project Managers who are into building real-world, high-trust applications.
 We‚Äôve launched Midcontract.com, a live platform that combinescryptopayments, escrow, and automated contracts into one streamlined experience for freelancers, agencies, and service teams.
Our mission is simple: help people work remotely, get paid fairly, and avoid centralized middlemen.
We‚Äôre now exploring new use cases and potential upgrades like:
On-chain contract logic & deal templates
Payment automation using Solidity or L2s
Modular smart contract components for white-label use
Token-gated contracts or DAO-native flows
Multi-party escrow and dispute resolution mechanisms


This isn‚Äôt just a one-off gig. We're open to meaningful long-term collaboration with Project Managers who:
Have experience leading Web3 or software development projects
Understand UX tradeoffs in contract-based systems
Have worked on payments, escrow, DAOs, or legal/compliance tools
Think like product people, not just task coordinators

Sounds like a good fit for you? Feel free to drop your proposal.

title: Luxury Wellness &CryptocurrencyBrand Designer/Illustrator
content: We are seeking a talented designer and illustrator to create captivating visuals for a luxury wellness brand that integratescryptocurrencyelements. The ideal candidate will have a strong portfolio demonstrating experience in high-end design and a unique artistic style. You will work closely with our branding team to develop illustrations and graphics that resonate with our target audience. If you are passionate about wellness and innovative technology, we want to hear from you!

title: Featured job posts
content: This client paid to post their job and reach freelancers like you.

title: Team Members Needed for Consensus Hackathon in Toronto
content:
I'm seeking passionate and innovative team members to join us for the Consensus Hackathon in Toronto from May 14-16, which will be part of the Consensus 2025 conference (organized by CoinDesk).
This is a fantastic opportunity to collaborate with like-minded individuals and work on cutting-edge blockchain projects. Ideal candidates should be familiar with hackathon environments (ideally Stellar or Aptos blockchains) and have a strong willingness to learn and share ideas. If you thrive in a fast-paced, creative setting and want to make an impact in the blockchain space, we want to hear from you!

title: Fundraising Support for Asset Management in Japan
content:
Job Title
 Fundraising and Investment Expert forCrypto/Forex Fund in Japan

Job Description
 Are you passionate aboutcryptoand forex investments and have a strong network in Japan? We at Kyoto London Nexus are looking for an experienced professional to help us grow our presence in the Japanese market.

About Us
 Kyoto London Nexus is a dynamiccrypto/forex fund that bridges traditional finance with the digital asset world. Led by our CFO, Yoshi Yamamoto, we are committed to creating sustainable and profitable investment opportunities. We already have a solid foundation, having raised over 1.5 million USD through partnerships with leadingcryptoinvestors and asset managers in Japan.

Our Strength in Japan
 We are proud to have a strong partnership with a renowned asset manager based in Shibuya, Tokyo. This partner specializes incryptoinvestments, blockchain technology, and medtech, and their office serves as a hub for our operations in Japan. This means that you will have access to a trusted and established presence in the heart of Tokyo, where you can meet with investors and associates face-to-face whenever needed.

What We Offer
 This is more than just a job; it‚Äôs an opportunity to build a long-term partnership with us. As we expand our network and secure additional funding, we are looking for someone who can grow with us and become an integral part of our team.

Responsibilities
Connect with potential investors across Japan.
Help structure and negotiate investment deals that align with our goals.
Share your expertise on the Japanese investment landscape, especially incryptoand forex.
Assist in our quarterly investor meetings held in Japan.




What We‚Äôre Looking For
A proven track record in fundraising and investment, with experience incrypto/forex being a plus.
A robust network within Japan‚Äôs investment community.
Fluency in Japanese.


Why Join Us?
Work closely with a dedicated team that values collaboration and innovation.
Be part of a growing fund that is making waves in thecryptoand forex space.
Leverage the support and resources of our established partner in Tokyo.


How to Apply
 We invite you to submit a proposal that highlights your experience, your connections in Japan, and why you believe you are the perfect fit for this role. Let‚Äôs explore how we can work together to achieve great things!

title: Market Research: SpanishCryptoMarket
content:
We are preparing to launch a fully licensed Virtual Asset Service Provider (VASP) company in Spain, offering the following services:

- Buy and sellcryptousing fiat (credit/debit card, SEPA bank transfers)
- Send, receive, and storecryptocurrenciessecurely
- Withdraw funds (cryptoto fiat) back to bank accounts or cards

We are seeking an experienced market researcher (preferably withcrypto/fintech experience) to conduct a comprehensive market analysis of the Spanishcryptolandscape.


1. Market Landscape

- Current state ofcryptoadoption in Spain
- Popular use cases and user behavior (trading, remittances, payments, savings)
- Key challenges and regulatory context (including MiCA transition)
- Analysis of why certaincryptocompanies in Spain failed or exited the market

2. Competitor Analysis

- Top VASP orcryptoplatforms currently operating in Spain
- Their services, user base, positioning, marketing strategies
- Any noticeable gaps or weaknesses in their offerings


3. Payment Behavior & Infrastructure

- Preferred payment methods in Spain (cards, IBAN, SEPA, Bizum, etc.)
- Use of cash vs. digital payments incrypto-related transactions
- Common banks used forcryptofunding/withdrawals and related friction or restrictions
- Analysis of card processors, bank policies, payment gateways forcryptouse cases


4. User Persona & Preferences

- Who is the averagecryptouser in Spain?
- Motivations, trust concerns, adoption drivers
- Popular coins, wallets, and trading volumes


5. Go-To-Market Strategy Recommendations

- Ideal entry strategy for a new player
- Recommended channels for user acquisition (online, offline, community-driven)
- Key partnerships or integrations (local banks, compliance tools, influencers, etc.)
- Legal and compliance factors to consider when launching


--

Deliverables:

- A detailed market research report (PDF or Google Docs format)
- Any relevant charts, tables, or visuals to support findings 
- Optional: 30-minute call to walk through key takeaways and recommendations


Requirements:

- Proven experience in market research, preferably incrypto, fintech, or payments
- Familiarity with Spanish financial regulations and consumer behavior
- Strong analytical and communication skills
- Fluency in English (Spanish language skills are a strong plus)


To Apply:
Please include:

- Brief summary of your relevant experience
- Examples of past research work (especially incryptoor Spanish markets)
- Your proposed timeframe and cost for completing the full project


We‚Äôre looking to move quickly - if you‚Äôre a fit, we‚Äôll schedule a short intro call within a few days.

Looking forward to it!

title: Web App Development for Aggregating Bitcoin Collateralized Loans
content:
We are seeking a skilled developer to build a simple web application that aggregates Bitcoin collateralized loan offers from two P2P platforms: Hodl Hodl (lend.hodlhodl.com) and Firefish. The app should display a table of active loan offers with filters for platform and currency, serving as a comparison tool for users.

Join us in building a platform that enhances the accessibility of Bitcoin loans!

Scope of Work:

Develop a web page with a responsive table showing loan details: Platform (Hodl Hodl or Firefish), Amount, Currency (e.g., USDT, EUR, USDC), Interest Rate (%), LTV (%), Duration (days).

Implement dropdown filters for Platform and Currency.

Fetch loan data from Hodl Hodl and Firefish using their APIs (if available) or compliant web scraping (must adhere to platforms‚Äô terms of service).

Store data in a lightweight database (e.g., SQLite) with periodic updates (e.g., hourly).

Use a backend framework like FastAPI (Python) or equivalent and a frontend with React, Vue.js, or plain HTML/CSS/JS.

Style the app with Tailwind CSS or similar for a clean, professional look.

Deploy the app to a hosting platform (e.g., Vercel, Heroku, or Netlify).

Provide documentation for running and maintaining the app.


Optional Features (Nice-to-Have):

Basic chart showing average interest rates by platform (e.g., using Chart.js).

Email or in-app alerts for new loan offers (can be a future phase).


Deliverables:

Source code in a GitHub repository.

Deployed web app with a live URL.

Documentation on setup, maintenance, and data update process.


Requirements:

Experience with Python (FastAPI preferred), JavaScript (React or similar), and database management (SQLite or PostgreSQL).

Familiarity with APIs, web scraping, orcrypto-related projects is a plus.

Ability to ensure compliance with platforms‚Äô terms (contact Hodl Hodl/Firefish for API access or scraping permission if needed).

Clear communication and regular progress updates.


Additional Notes:

Sample Python (FastAPI) and React code is available to use as a starting point (will share upon hiring).

The app must be secure (HTTPS) and scalable for potential future additions (e.g., more platforms).


Please include in your proposal:


Your experience with relevant technologies (Python, FastAPI, React, etc.).

Links to similar projects or portfolio.

Estimated time and cost.

Your approach to data collection (API or scraping) and ensuring compliance.

Looking forward to your proposals!

title: Legal Consultant Needed ‚Äì Global Entity Setup for Blockchain-Based Donation Platform
content:
We are developing a global donation platform powered by blockchain technology. At the core of our mission is full transparency, smart contract automation, and ethical giving ‚Äî and we want to comply with the highest donation standards (similar to Dutch regulations), while operating from a jurisdiction that iscrypto-friendly, internationally accessible, and fiscally sustainable.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre looking for an experienced legal consultant to help us design the optimal international legal, regulatory, and tax structure for our organization.

Important:
In your first reply, please include an estimated number of hours required and total cost (fixed or hourly with a rough range). This will help us evaluate scope and planning from the start.

About the Platform:
We‚Äôre building an impact-first donation ecosystem where:
- Donors can make secure, direct, and trackable donations globally.
- All transactions are recorded on the blockchain.
- Charities provide verified proof of spending before funds are released via smart contracts.
- Donors earn rewards, impact points, and engage through gamification and social features.

What We Need:
We are seeking legal expertise to guide us in:
- Choosing the best jurisdiction(s) to register and operate from.
- Understandingcryptoregulations and donation laws in key countries.
- Structuring the organization for maximum tax efficiency without compromising on compliance or transparency.
- Clarifying licensing or regulatory requirements for operating a donation-based platform usingcryptocurrencies.

Ideal Consultant:
- Legal expert with experience in international corporate structuring,cryptocompliance, non-profit regulation, or all of the above.
- Familiar with tax systems, NGO laws, and/or licensing frameworks in multiple countries.
- Experience with donation platforms, fintech startups, or internationalcryptooperations is a strong plus.
- Able to produce clear and actionable legal recommendations.

Deliverables:
- A concise advisory report outlining:
- Recommended country or countries for registration
- Legal, tax, and compliance pros and cons
- Next steps and potential legal partners if needed

(Optional) Ongoing guidance or introductions to local legal experts

title: Need full stack development / AI experts to help me build an automatedcryptotax software
content: We're building a freemium web app forcryptotraders that instantly calculates realized gains and tax exposure just by pasting in a wallet address (no sign-up required). The MVP will support major DEX wallets (e.g., MetaMask, Phantom, etc.) and use FIFO cost basis to generate real-time P&L summaries over adjustable date ranges. On the backend, we'll fetch wallet transaction histories via free public APIs (e.g., Covalent, Alchemy, Solana RPC), parse trades/swaps, and calculate realized gains. The free version will show full wallet history and summary data; the premium tier (e.g., $199/year) unlocks IRS-ready Form 8949 export, monthly summaries, gas/trading fee deduction calculators, and multi-wallet support. Simple UI, fast load times, and no setup friction are critical ‚Äî this needs to feel magical in 5 seconds.

title: Build and Deploy Hummingbot with custom strategy to Peg Token to Live Gold Price (DeFi/Uniswap)
content:
1. Fetch Real-Time Gold Price

Connect to a public or private external API (e.g., MetalsAPI, GoldAPI, or custom endpoint) to retrieve the current USD price of 1 oz of gold.
Allow customization of:
API URL and headers (for tokens/keys)
Polling interval (e.g., every 60 seconds)
Optionally, conversion between currencies (e.g., EUR to USD)
Store the live gold price as the reference peg for Dorol (1 DRL = 1 oz of gold in USD)
2. Monitor Uniswap Pool (DRL/USDC or DRL/ETH)

Read real-time on-chain liquidity data from a specific Uniswap v2 or v3 pool:
Use either Hummingbot‚Äôs Gateway or web3.py to fetch reserve balances
Calculate spot price: Price = USDC_reserve / DRL_reserve
Detect when the current pool price deviates from the live gold price peg
Configurable threshold (e.g., ¬±0.5% deviation triggers action)
3. Execute Trades to Maintain Peg

If price is above peg: Execute sell DRL to push price down
If price is below peg: Execute buy DRL to push price up
Include:
Slippage protection
Gas usage limit
Trade cooldown period (rate limiting)
Trade size limits per execution
Trades must be sent via wallet with private key (Hummingbot-compatible wallet)
Strategy must be adjustable via .yml or .env configuration
4. (Optional but Preferred) Manage Liquidity on Uniswap v3

Add or remove liquidity within a tight price range around the current gold peg (e.g., $2950‚Äì$3050)
Automatically remove and re-deploy liquidity if price moves out of range
Use Uniswap‚Äôs NFT position manager for v3 LP tokens
Optional: set liquidity concentration, fee tier, and capital allocation
5. Logging and Monitoring

Record logs of all price checks, trades, and liquidity moves
Export to CSV or store in local SQLite/JSON format


Developer Requirements
The ideal developer should have:

‚úÖ Strong Python development experience
‚úÖ Familiarity with Hummingbot architecture (custom strategies/plugins)
‚úÖ Experience working with Ethereum-based DEXs like Uniswap
‚úÖWeb3knowledge: reading pools, sending transactions, gas management
‚úÖ Ability to work with external REST APIs (e.g., gold price oracles)
Bonus:
Knowledge of Uniswap v3 liquidity management (NFT LP positions)
Prior experience building DeFi trading bots or peg stabilizers


 Deliverables
Custom Strategy Code
Fully functional plugin or script compatible with Hummingbot CLI
Clean, well-commented Python codebase
Configuration File(s)
Example .yml or .env file for setting API keys, thresholds, and parameters
README Documentation
Setup guide (install dependencies, configure bot, run strategy)
Deployment instructions (local/Docker/cloud VPS)
Gold price APIintegrationsteps
Basic Test Results
Simulation results using testnet (or sandbox address)
Example log output (trades, peg deviation triggers)
(Optional) Liquidity manager script for Uniswap v3, or notes forintegration

title: Looking for Expert Developer to Build Fully Automated Crypto Arbitrage Bot (Multi-CEX Support)
content:
I‚Äôm looking for a skilled and experienced developer to build a fully automated crypto arbitrage bot capable of identifying and executing profitable trades across multiple centralized exchanges (CEXs). We will start with 2 exchanges (e.g., KuCoin and Bybit), but the final goal is to scale the system to support up to 5 CEXs in total.

Important:
This must not be a simple trading bot like Bitsgap that buys and sells simultaneously on the same exchange. The bot must be capable of transferring funds automatically between exchanges to exploit real arbitrage opportunities, buying on one exchange and selling on another after the transfer is complete.

Core Features Required:
	1.	Arbitrage Strategy:
	‚Ä¢	Monitor price discrepancies between exchanges in real time.
	‚Ä¢	Buy crypto (with USDT) on Exchange A, transfer it to Exchange B, and sell it for USDT, capturing profit from the spread.
	2.	Automatic Execution:
	‚Ä¢	Full automation: the bot must buy, transfer, and sell without manual intervention.
	3.	Profitability&Risk Management:
	‚Ä¢	Minimize slippage, fees, and failed transfers.
	‚Ä¢	Allow customization for risk tolerance and minimum profit thresholds.
	4.	Capital Management:
	‚Ä¢	Manage a fixed capital split across exchanges using USDT.
	‚Ä¢	Limit exposure to volatility with smart capital allocation.
	5.	Real-Time Notifications:
	‚Ä¢	Provide alerts on trade executions, fund transfers, and profits via a dashboard or messagingintegration.
	6.	Speed&Efficiency:
	‚Ä¢	The bot must be fast and reliable, with quick execution logic to take advantage of short-lived arbitrage windows.

Requirements:
	‚Ä¢	Demonstrated experience building crypto arbitrage bots.
	‚Ä¢	Proficiency with CEX APIs (KuCoin, Bybit, Binance, MEXC, etc.).
	‚Ä¢	Ability to build efficient logic for cross-exchange transfers and executions.
	‚Ä¢	Solid understanding of fee minimization and risk strategies in real-world trading environments.
	‚Ä¢	Experience with real-time systems and notifications.

To Apply, Please Include:
	‚Ä¢	Estimated time to deliver a working prototype (starting with 2 exchanges).
	‚Ä¢	Examples of relevant past projects.
	‚Ä¢	Tech stack and architecture you propose for this build.

We‚Äôre ready to start right away. If you can build a high-performance, secure, and scalable arbitrage solution, I‚Äôd love to hear from you. ü´∂üèº
